title.narrative: Technical and financial support of trained radio for the production of content in Senegal

description.narrative: Results: - 15 magazines and 15 debates (30 production sin total) were realized and broadcasted by the radio stations of the cohort. - Amongst the 140 stakeholders mobilized, 15.25% were local elected representatives, and 21.17% were religious leaders - 67% of the production topics were related to violence against women, including: early pregnancy at school, economic violence exerted by husbands, consequences of child marriages in girls' schooling, domestic violence against women, the consequences of female circumcision, the psychological violence against women, which is not perceived as a violence. - Radios stations have relied much more on the radio-clubs members as sources of information, as well as resources to animate their broadcasts. Some radio stations have regularly solicited CRCs’ members to identify new resource persons outside of the clubs in order to run talk shows. - Local spaces have been opened where women CBOs can open the conversations with local authorities and challenge them on specific issues about their rights. - Women CBOs have been able to address specific requests at the local level which are considered by local decision-makers.

the 15 radio stations that benefited from training on magazine and debate techniques were expected to produce magazines and conduct informative debates on women's rights in Senegal. The objective was to initiate a local debate between local women and organizations. In order to better supervise these productions, a follow up plan was drawn up and its implementation was supervised by URAC .
